Atthana Jātaka：On the untrustworthiness and treacherousness of women．A young merchant，Mahādhana，patronised a courtesan，giving her a thousand pieces daily．One day，having no time to fetch the money，he went empty-handed and was cast out．Thereupon，in disgust，he became an ascetic （J．iii．474ff）．

The story is related to a monk who wished to leave the Order on account of a woman．
